comment: Dr. Kelley is one of the best teachers I've had. Truly passionate about teaching and will do everything she can to help you succeed.

Dr. Kelley is great! Most of the grades in this class come from participation and presentations. There are also some vocab quizzes, but we hardly review the vocab in class so be sure to study those on your own. Very participation-based, but if you're here to enrich your German speaking skills it's a good opportunity!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's a nice person, but not so great at explaining rather difficult grammar concepts.  She also can be a bit condescending if you make a grammatical error from a concept that was learned in 1001.  If you never TOOK that class, it's hard to remember grammar rules from it...

Frau Kelley is an awesome pofessor. There were a lot of papers to write in this class, but you get a chance to correct them. She is not too harsh with grade. Make sure to keep up with all the homework, and always come to class. She is available during office hours more than othr Professors if you ever have questions. I would definatley recomend her

Dr. Kelley knows her stuff. She isn't that strict with the grades and doesn't seem to follow the department syllabus to the letter (especially when it comes to grading), but she has little mercy. As long as you do the work and complete all the assignments she will pass you. She has no control over the tests, though, so you have to be prepared.

I've had 5 classes with her now, she is great! It's an easy A as long as you do all of the assignments. Not too harsh of a grader, I would take her for every German class if I could! I would recommend her to anyone!

Amazing professor! Definitely recommend her for learning the language. Lots of group work, first non-graded conversation is awkward, but it gets easier throughout the semester. Easy tests as long as you open the textbook.Pushes you to participate!

I had Professor Kelley for the Grammer/Compositon class and the Converstion class. She is a wonderful person; she really loves teaching her classes, at all levels. Sometimes, she did get a bit off topic, but she is very kind and sincere to everyone. I would allways recommend her.

I had her for The Grammer and Compositon Class in the Fall, which was a more difficult Forging Lanuage Class. However, she is a very nice person and flexible with when assingments are due. She is funny and passionate about theaching the material. Sometimes her lectures could be more structured, though.

She is totally awesome. Really nice. Tons of stuff to keep your grade up. Very helpful, fun, is from Germany. Wants you to succeed. Extra credit opportunities and on the tests. Overall one of the best teachers I have had.

Frau Kelley is an awsome teacher.  She really wants her students to learn.  There is a lot of writting and the roleplays emphasize that she wants you to be comfortable speaking the language.  If you have questions then ask in class or drop by her office.  She is fairly flexible with assingments due and there is a lot of online homework. Tests r ok.

Dr. Kelley is a great German professor. She is flexible and very clear with what she wants from you. Projects/essays required a lot of effort, as they are in German. We did a German book report that was challenging if you don't have a great grasp on the language. I consider myself average and made a B. I would recommend her to anyone!

She is a pretty good teacher. The class moves really fast so you have to spend a lot of time on your own trying to learn the material. I would recommend her to someone who is willing to put in the work. If you are looking for an easy A that requires no attendance or outside work, look elsewhere.

I love Dr. Kelley! she is so hilarious and entertaining. She's a true German teach, she wants you to be able to speak the language. She does her lessons from ppt, which is great for language. Just be sure to come to class because she takes her tests from the lectures. definitely take her!

Probably my favorite class this semester.  Some of the material our class has gone over this semester is quite difficult (different cases, adjective endings), but Dr. Kelly is extremely helpful.  She teaches all the material very well, and she is very flexible when it comes to due dates on assignments.  I highly recommend taking her class. (:

Great class. Dr. Kelley doesn't usually teach straight from the textbook. Instead she explains grammar rules and vocab and then gives the students a chance to learn by speaking and listening. Also very accommodating. If you have a legitimate reason for missing an assignment or test/quiz, she usually lets you make them up. Highly recommended.

Frau Kelley is an awesome teacher. She takes a personal interest in her students and makes the class enjoyable for the most part. Nothing is on the tests that she doesn't prepare the class for. Just be sure to do the online workbook and to participate in the class conversations.
Great instructor. Makes learning fun. Easy class and you actually learn. EXTREMELY helpful.

very easy class if you simply pay attention and do the homework. most of class spent doing oral exercises, so make a friend so you will have a partner. come to class because she throws alot of her own vocab into the lessons. she is awesome if you take the time to get to know her.

Great teacher! She's nice, funny, helpful, and flexible with due dates and homework. However, she expects a decent fluency from the students. Oral exams are not hard, but pronounciation is very important. Overall, great class; great teacher; easy A.
